overview: From 2025-11-01 to 2025-12-01, elizaos-plugins/plugin-openrouter had 1 new PRs (1 merged), 0 new issues, and 1 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat(plugin-openrouter): add TEXT_EMBEDDING model support
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
Changes:
- Created models/embedding.ts with handleTextEmbedding handler
- Added getEmbeddingModel() to utils/config.ts
- Registered TEXT_EMBEDDING model type in plugin definition
- Added configuration support:
  - OPENROUTER_EMBEDDING_MODEL (default: openai/text-embedding-3-small)
  - OPENROUTER_EMBEDDING_DIMENSIONS (default: 1536)
  - Fallbacks to EMBEDDING_MODEL and EMBEDDING_DIMENSIONS
- Added comprehensive integration tests:
  - Embedding generation with object params
  - String input handling
  - Null input test vector generation
  - Configuration validation tests
- Updated README with embedding configuration docs
- Updated models/index.ts to export embedding handler

Features:
- Full OpenAI-compatible embeddings API support
- Configurable embedding dimensions (512, 768, 1024, 1536, 3072)
- Proper error handling and fallback vectors
- Usage tracking via emitModelUsageEvent
- OpenRouter-specific headers (HTTP-Referer, X-Title)

All tests passing (14/14). No breaking changes.

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Adds OpenRouter text embedding support with configurable dimensions, registers the model, updates config, and adds tests/docs.
> 
> - **Plugin/Models**:
>   - Add `TEXT_EMBEDDING` model with handler `handleTextEmbedding` (OpenRouter `/embeddings` endpoint, usage tracking, validation/fallbacks).
>   - Register `ModelType.TEXT_EMBEDDING` in `src/index.ts` and export from `src/models/index.ts`.
> - **Configuration**:
>   - New settings: `OPENROUTER_EMBEDDING_MODEL`, `OPENROUTER_EMBEDDING_DIMENSIONS` with fallbacks to `EMBEDDING_MODEL`/`EMBEDDING_DIMENSIONS`.
>   - Add `getEmbeddingModel` and dimension handling in `src/utils/config.ts`.
> - **Tests**:
>   - Add embedding tests (object/string/null inputs, registration, config access) in `__tests__/models.test.ts` and `__tests__/config.test.ts`.
> - **Docs**:
>   - Update `__tests__/README.md` with embedding model config and dimensions.
> - **Version**:
>   - Bump package to `1.5.15`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit a44c0cd8a770742d7bee75a92a69b0ccec219740. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added text embedding support via OpenRouter with configurable model and dimension settings (512, 768, 1024, 1536, 3072).
  * New configuration options: `EMBEDDING_MODEL` and `EMBEDDING_DIMENSIONS`.

* **Chores**
  * Version bumped to 1.5.15.
  * Code formatting and style improvements.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topContributors.summary: standujar: Focused on significant feature development, opening a pull request to implement entity-level row level security in elizaos/eliza (#6107). This substantial work involved changes to 31 files and added over 1500 lines of code. All of their activity this month was concentrated on this single feature.

wtfsayo: This month, wtfsayo focused on maintenance and refactoring within the `elizaos-plugins/plugin-mcp` repository. Their sole merged pull request, #18, updated action names and dependencies, resulting in a significant code cleanup that removed over 400 lines. This work involved an even split of feature, bugfix, and other tasks, touching code, documentation, and configuration files.

0xbbjoker: This month, 0xbbjoker focused on extending plugin functionality by opening a pull request to add text embedding model support to the OpenRouter plugin (elizaos-plugins/plugin-openrouter#17). This feature work involved changes across 9 files, including both application code and corresponding tests. The contribution demonstrates a clear focus on expanding feature capabilities within the plugin ecosystem.

ai16x402: This month, ai16x402 focused on expanding the plugin ecosystem by opening three pull requests in elizaos-plugins/registry (#239, #238, #237) to add new plugins. Their contributions consisted of 7 commits modifying configuration files to support these additions. They also left 3 comments on pull requests.
